alert.note: Alert for Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Refugio; Goliad; Inland Calhoun; Inland Refugio; Live Oak; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 8:50AM CST until January 15 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the first Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 degrees. For the second Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 above zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Live Oak, Bee, Goliad, Victoria, Coastal Aransas, Inland Refugio, Inland Calhoun, Coastal Refugio and Coastal Calhoun. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the first Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM to 11 PM CST this evening. For the second Wind Chill Warning, from 11 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Refugio; Goliad; Inland Calhoun; Inland Refugio; Live Oak; Victoria
